titleStmt.title: [Lessons for consort] [made by sundry excellent authors, and set to sixe severall instruments, namely, the treble lute, treble violl, base violl, bandora, citterne, and the flute ; now newly set forth by Philip Rosseter].
titleStmt.author: Rosseter, Philip, 1567 or 8-1623.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Tho. Este alias Snodham for Iohn Browne, and are to be sould at his shop,

notesStmt.note: Title and first part of statement of responsibility suggested by STC (2nd ed.).
Second part of statement of responsibility suggested by NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Running title: For the treble lute.
Attributed to Rosseter by STC (2nd ed.).
Place of imprint and name of publisher suggested by NUC pre-1956 imprints; date of publication suggested STC (2nd ed.) and NUC pre-1956 imprints.
Imperfect: t.p. and pages before p. [6] and after p. 9 lacking.
Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
